DOC.brief_summary: Guided self-help ( GSH ) recommend first-step treatment bulimia nervosa , binge eat disorder , atypical variant disorder . The current study proposes investigate effectiveness provide GSH either face-to-face via e-mail , also use delay treatment control condition . Symptom outcome assess , estimate cost-effectiveness make . Results propose disseminate locally internationally ( submission conference peer-reviewed journal ) , hopefully inform local service provision . Please note able offer intervention individual currently register General Practitioner cover Oxford Health NHS Foundation Trust - typically restricted practice Oxfordshire , Buckinghamshire , part Wiltshire .
DOC.criteria: Registration General Practitioner cover Oxford Health NHS Foundation Trust ( typically : Oxfordshire , Buckinghamshire , part Wiltshire ) Primary diagnosis eat disorder recurrent binge eating ( BN , EDNOS [ BNtype ] BED ) Age 17.5 year ( box require whole number ) A severe eat disorder ( e.g. , one complicate medical issue would best manage selfhelp intervention ) BMI < 18.5 Rapid weight loss ( regardless BMI ) current excessive drug use active untreated psychosis ( latter two usually exclusion criterion EDS )
